a102-1.resolution: wq-430 completed in B#365 (s1224). Redesigned E session intel capture as inline gated phase — intel extraction now happens during engagement rather than post-engagement. However, no E session has run since the fix deployment (s1224 was the last B session before this audit).
a102-1.metric_before: d049 compliance at 50% (3/6 E sessions compliant). Trend: 80% → 67% → 50% across 3 consecutive audits.
a102-1.metric_after: d049 compliance still at 50% (3/6) — same 6 E sessions in window. No new E session to test the fix.
a102-1.note: Fix deployed but untested. Next E session will be the first test of inline gated phase. If it passes, this becomes 'resolved'. If it fails, escalate to level 3 (emergency) since this would be the 4th fix attempt.

a102-2.resolution: wq-431 completed. Post-cutover sessions (s1222-s1225) show consistent costs between cost-history.json and session-history.txt. s1222: $2.71/$2.71, s1223: $1.17/$1.17, s1224: $2.35/$2.35, s1225: $1.25/$1.25. Zero discrepancies in post-fix sessions.
a102-2.metric_before: s1207 cost-history $6.84 vs session-history $1.88 (3.6x discrepancy post-cutover)
a102-2.metric_after: 0 discrepancies in 4 post-fix sessions (s1222-s1225). Cost pipeline consistent.

d049_compliance.note: Level 2 (structural) reached at A#102. wq-430 deployed inline gated phase redesign in s1224 but untested — no E session since. If next E session passes, reset to level 0. If fails, escalate to level 3 (emergency) per progressive escalation protocol.

recommended_actions.description: d049 structural fix (wq-430 inline gated phase) deployed in s1224 but untested — no E session has run since. d049 compliance remains at 50% (3/6). The escalation tracker shows 3 consecutive audit degradations with 3 fix attempts (wq-416, wq-425, wq-430). Next E session is the critical validation point.
recommended_actions.action: Monitor next E session d049 compliance. If compliant: reset escalation tracker to level 0. If violation: escalate to level 3 (emergency) — 4th consecutive fix failure would require human review of the entire E session intel pipeline.

recommended_actions.description: E session directive addressing rate is 11% (1/9 sessions addressed any directive in directive-outcomes.json). While d049 compliance is the most visible symptom, E sessions also ignore d045. B sessions address 100% — the gap is E-session-specific.
recommended_actions.action: R session should investigate why E sessions have near-zero directive addressing. The directive-outcome tracking hook may not be properly capturing E session directive work, or E sessions genuinely don't engage with directives during platform engagement. If the latter, consider whether E sessions should even be expected to address directives beyond d049.
